alert.note: Alert for Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:49PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Bernard and north central Plaquemines Parishes through 530 PM CDT... At 448 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout or funnel clouds over marshy areas of St. Bernard Parish, or 8 miles southeast of Shell Beach, or 22 miles northeast of Port Sulphur, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts or funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern St. Bernard and north central Plaquemines Parishes. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If you see a waterspout or funnel cloud, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
